      • maxQueryLen

        public abstract int maxQueryLen()
        Returns:
        maximum length of string that can be send as query to search engine excluding parts of the query such as the path in a URL.

      • filterPhrases

        public boolean filterPhrases(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> pPhrases)
                      throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Description copied from interface: RestrictedSearchEngine
        RestrictedQuery instance will try to ensure that search engine filters out pages containing specified phrases in a search.

        The list of phrases is considered exhaustive and will replace any set of phrases previously provided through this method.

        Specified by:
        filterPhrases in interface RestrictedSearchEngine<java.lang.String,java.net.URL,java.net.URL>
        Parameters:
        pPhrases - Pages containing any of pPhrases might be filtered from search results.
        Returns:
        true is returned if RestrictedQuery instance is capable of generating a blacklist of phrases for search engine. false is returned otherwise and if so the RestrictedQuery implementation will continue to behave as it did before this method invocation.
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException

      • filterSites

        public boolean filterSites(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> pSites)
                    throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Description copied from interface: RestrictedSearchEngine
        RestrictedQuery instance will try to ensure that search engine filters out pages from any of these sites in a search.

        The list of sites is considered exhaustive and will replace any set of sites previously provided through this method.

        Specified by:
        filterSites in interface RestrictedSearchEngine<java.lang.String,java.net.URL,java.net.URL>
        Parameters:
        pSites - Pages from sites might be filtered from search results.
        Returns:
        true is returned if RestrictedQuery instance is capable of generating a blacklist of sites for search engine. false is returned otherwise and if so the RestrictedQuery implementation will continue to behave as it did before this method invocation.
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
